title: [Large-Scale] Instructional Design for Evidence Reliability Assessment Through Collaborative Inquiry

context.prior_knowledge: Basic statistical knowledge, understanding of scientific inquiry methodologies, and foundational VR/simulation tool operation skills
context.additional_context: VR/simulation-based collaborative learning process for pre-service teachers to develop evidence credibility assessment skills using mathematical data in complex socio-scientific contexts

learning_goals: Learners evaluate evidence reliability across three or more dimensions (source, methodology, potential bias) by analyzing genetically modified crop cultivation data in VR simulation environments
Learners can document their decision-making process by applying a structured discussion framework (CLA Framework) to verify the validity of evidence through collaborative inquiry with peer teachers.
Learners can demonstrate a 30% or higher improvement in accuracy of evidence reliability assessment through pre- and post-evaluation score comparisons.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
